Interferometer¶

pycis.model.interferometer.mueller_product(mat1, mat2)[source]¶

Compute the product of two Mueller matrices.

Parameters

  • mat1 (xr.DataArray) – Mueller matrix.

  • mat2 (xr.DataArray) – Mueller matrix or Stokes vector.

Returns

(xr.DataArray) mat1 @ mat2, a Mueller matrix or a Stokes vector, depending on the dimensions of mat2.

pycis.model.interferometer.rotation_matrix(angle)[source]¶

Mueller matrix for frame rotation (anti-clockwise from x-axis).

Parameters

angle (float) – rotation angle in degrees.

Returns

(xr.DataArray) Frame rotation Mueller matrix.

class pycis.model.interferometer.Filter(tx, n)[source]¶

Optical filter with no polarisation-dependent behaviour.

Parameters

  • tx (xr.DataArray) – Fractional filter transmission, whose dimension ‘wavelength’ has coordinates in m.

  • n (float) – Refractive index (effective).

class pycis.model.interferometer.LinearPolariser(orientation, tx_1=1, tx_2=0)[source]¶

Linear polariser.

Parameters

  • orientation (float) – Orientation in degrees of the transmission axis relative to the x-axis.

  • tx_1 (float) – transmission primary component. [0, 1] - defaults to 1.

  • tx_2 (float) – transmission secondary (orthogonal) component. [0, 1] - defaults to 0.

get_mueller_matrix(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶
Parameters

  • args –

  • kwargs –

Returns

class pycis.model.interferometer.UniaxialCrystal(orientation, thickness, cut_angle, material='a-BBO', material_source=None, contrast=1)[source]¶

Plane-parallel uniaxial birefringent crystal plate.

Parameters

  • orientation (float) – Orientation of component fast axis in degrees, relative to the x-axis.

  • thickness (float) – Crystal thickness in m.

  • cut_angle (float) – Angle in degrees between crystal optic axis and front face.

  • material (str) – Crystal material.

  • material_source (str) – Source of Sellmeier coefficients describing dispersion in the crystal. If blank, the default material source specified in pycis.model.dispersion

  • contrast (float) – An arbitrary contrast degradation factor for the retarder, independent of ray path. Value between 0 and 1. Simulates the effect of real crystal imperfections.

get_delay(wavelength, inc_angle, azim_angle, n_e=None, n_o=None)[source]¶

Calculate imparted delay in radians.

Parameters

  • wavelength (float, xr.DataArray) – Wavelength in m.

  • inc_angle (float, xr.DataArray) – Ray incidence angle(s) in radians.

  • azim_angle (float, xr.DataArray) – Ray azimuthal angle(s) in radians.

  • n_e (float) – Manually set extraordinary refractive index (e.g. for fitting).

  • n_o (float) – Manually set ordinary refractive index (e.g. for fitting).

Returns

(float, xr.DataArray) Imparted delay in radians.

get_fringe_frequency(wavelength, focal_length)[source]¶

Calculate the (approx.) spatial frequency of the fringe pattern at the sensor plane.

Parameters

  • focal_length (float) – Focal length of imaging lens in m.

  • wavelength (float) – Wavelength in m.

Returns

(tuple) x and y components of the fringe frequency in units m^-1 and in order (f_x, f_y).

class pycis.model.interferometer.SavartPlate(orientation, thickness, material='a-BBO', material_source=None, contrast=1, mode='francon')[source]¶

Savart plate.

Parameters

  • orientation (float) – Orientation of component fast axis in degrees, relative to the x-axis.

  • thickness (float) – Total thickness of plate in m.

  • material (str) – Crystal material.

  • material_source (str) – Source of Sellmeier coefficients describing dispersion in the crystal. If blank, the default material source specified in pycis.model.dispersion

  • contrast (float) – An arbitrary contrast degradation factor for the retarder, independent of ray path. Value between 0 and 1. Simulates the effect of real crystal imperfections.

  • mode (str) – Determines how impartedd delay is calculated: ‘francon’ (approx.) or ‘veiras’ (exact).

get_delay(wavelength, inc_angle, azim_angle, n_e=None, n_o=None)[source]¶

Calculate imparted delay in radians.

Parameters

  • wavelength (float, xr.DataArray) – Wavelength in m.

  • inc_angle (float, xr.DataArray) – Ray incidence angle(s) in radians.

  • azim_angle (float, xr.DataArray) – Ray azimuthal angle(s) in radians.

  • n_e (float) – manually set extraordinary refractive index (e.g. for fitting).

  • n_o (float) – manually set ordinary refractive index (e.g. for fitting).

Returns

(float, xr.DataArray) Imparted delay in radians.

get_fringe_frequency(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Spatial frequency of the fringe pattern at the sensor plane in units m^-1.

class pycis.model.interferometer.IdealWaveplate(orientation, delay)[source]¶

Ideal waveplate imparting a given delay to all rays.

Parameters

  • orientation (float) – Orientation of component fast axis in degrees, relative to the x-axis.

  • delay (float) – Imparted delay in radians.

get_delay(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Interferometer delay in radians.

get_fringe_frequency(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Spatial frequency of the fringe pattern at the sensor plane in units m^-1.
